solution_line_template: And five jackets normally cost {jacket_qty} x ${jacket_price} = $<<{jacket_qty}*{jacket_price}={jacket_normal_total}>>{jacket_normal_total}.
So, a discount of {jacket_discount_rate} x ${jacket_normal_total} = $<<{jacket_discount_rate}*{jacket_normal_total}={jacket_discount}>>{jacket_discount} for the five jackets.
Thus, the selling price of the five jackets is ${jacket_normal_total} - ${jacket_discount} = $<<{jacket_normal_total}-{jacket_discount}={jacket_sale_total}>>{jacket_sale_total}.
Hence, the total cost of all the items is ${tshirt_total} + ${sweater_total} + ${jacket_sale_total} = $<<{tshirt_total}+{sweater_total}+{jacket_sale_total}={total_items_cost}>>{total_items_cost}.
The sales tax is equal to {sales_tax_rate} x ${total_items_cost} = $<<{sales_tax_rate}*{total_items_cost}={sales_tax}>>{sales_tax}.
Therefore, Kevin has to pay ${total_items_cost} + ${sales_tax} = $<<{total_items_cost}+{sales_tax}={answer}>>{answer}. including the sales tax.
